communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Syracuse City School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Suffolk County Community College, Selden)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL]New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Suffolk County Community College, Selden)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

I am writing to formally acknowledge your Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) request, received by the College on March 6, 2025.

The College will respond to this request, by providing the records requested, to the extent that they exist and may be disclosed, on or before April 10, 2025.

With respect to the numerous questions contained in your request, please note that Article 6 of the New York State Public Officers Law, known as the Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”), permits members of the public to request and inspect “reasonably described” “records” of public agencies.  It is not, however, a mechanism for posing and receiving answers to written questions.  As stated in FOIL Advisory Opinion 16632a<https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f16632a.htm>, issued by the New York State Committee on Open Government:  “Very simply, there is nothing in the Freedom of Information Law or the Open Meetings Law that requires that government officers or employees respond to questions, supply information in response to questions or offer explanations for their governmental activities.”  Furthermore, as explained in FOIL Advisory Opinion 18795<https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f18795.html>, “an agency need not create a record in response to a request for information.”  Therefore, to the extent that the College does not maintain records which may be responsive to several of the questions listed below (i.e., average tenure, current turnover rate, how frequently are job description updated), the FOIL statute does not require to a public agency to create records in order to respond to a FOIL request.

Note that once responsive records – i.e., the College’s payroll and collective bargaining agreements -  are gathered in response to this FOIL request, they may contain answers to some the questions posed below (i.e., how are salaries adjusted, date compensation plan(s) were implemented, do you compensate faculty differently based on the area of discipline, etc.).  However, the answers will be able to be retrieved from a review of the relevant collective bargaining agreements.


Alla Brodsky, Esq.
Deputy General Counsel
Suffolk County Community College
Ammerman Campus
Email: brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu<mailto:brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu>

PRIVILEGED & CONFIDENTIAL
ATTORNEY-CLIENT COMMUNICATION/ATTORNEY WORK PRODUCT
INTER-OFFICE/INTRA-AGENCY COMMUNICATION
NOT SUBJECT TO FOIL DISCLOSURE/NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Enclosed please find the current Employee Report maintained by Suffolk County Community College (the “College”).
Most College employees are members of the following bargaining units:


  1.  Faculty Association of Suffolk County Community College;
  2.  the Guild of Administrative Officers of Suffolk County Community College, and
  3.  the Association of Municipal Employees, Inc.

The College also employs Exempt Employees.  Collective bargaining agreements, including salary charts for each unit, as well as the Exempt Salary and Benefits Plan are available at the following link:  Evergreen solutions - compensation study<https://sunysuffolk-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/brodskya_sunysuffolk_edu/EhL2FyrDZ99Nk-30JBoaF20BJttrN5ZVFERb64VrLYxTyA?email=alisia%40consultevergreen.com&e=qRa8TR>.

I trust that the enclosed records address your request. However, should you wish to appeal this response, you have a right to submit an appeal in writing, within thirty (30) days of the date of this correspondence, to the College General Counsel:

Ashley Pope
College General Counsel
Suffolk County Community College
533 College Road – NFL 230
Selden, NY 11784
popea@sunysuffolk.edu<mailto:popea@sunysuffolk.edu>


A complete appeal must include the date of requests for records; a description, to the extent possible, of the records to which access was denied; and the name and return address of the individual submitting the appeal. A determination will be made on the appeal within ten (10) business days of receipt of the appeal.


Alla Brodsky, Esq.
Deputy General Counsel
Suffolk County Community College
Ammerman Campus

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL]New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Suffolk County Community College, Selden)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I apologize for the delay in responding to you.  The College does not maintain an electronic database of job descriptions.
If you refer to the Active Employee Report I shared with you on April 10th, 2025, for all employees listed which are in the Association of Municipal Employees ("AME") Bargaining Unit, the job descriptions for each employee's title are set by the County of Suffolk Civil Service Department, and are available through the Civil Service Website.  Please refer to the following website:  Listing of all Job Titles (suffolkcountyny.gov)<https://apps2.suffolkcountyny.gov/civilservice/civilserviceinquiry/AllTitlesAction.aspx>.  For each AME employee, if you do a search for their "Department Title" on this webpage, as it appears on the spreadsheet shared with you (i.e., "Senior Office Assistant", "College Aide", "Laborer"), you will be able to access the job description.

Job descriptions for College's Exempt Administrators have been uploaded for you, and are accessible through the following link:  Job Descriptions<https://sunysuffolk-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/brodskya_sunysuffolk_edu/EmwIA1PESKFKgYYuwMt2SFgB_N6K4Snm2pBDHZ5xoLsVEA?e=j0aqUG>.

As far as job descriptions for remaining College employees, those who belong to the Guild and the Faculty Association bargaining units, the College do not maintain job descriptions database.  If you can specify which employees' job descriptions specifically you are looking for, from the list of employees provided to you, we can attempt to locate and retrieve the particular job description.  Please note that the College employs thousands of employees.

Alla Brodsky, Esq.
Deputy General Counsel
Suffolk County Community College
Ammerman Campus
Email: brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu<mailto:brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu>

PRIVILEGED & CONFIDENTIAL

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: General Inmate Records :: G020767-050625
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Georgia Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Open Records Act, O.C.G.A. 50-18-70, et seq. Your request was received in this office on 5/6/2025 and given the reference number G020767-050625 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-corrections-3973%252Fgeorgia-doc-transgender-policies-186216%252F%253Femail%253Dopen.records%252540gdc.ga.gov&url_auth_token=AAANHY2nxVq5JcxBdc5g5qj1bGY%3A1uCUUW%3ABVgc7qAYLAJTpZsmFECR6jfGQSGyoHDQ1yZFGTsqfEc 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
PLEASE NOTE: The Open Records Act does not require a governmental body to prepare new reports, summaries, or compilations not in existence at the time of the request, or to answer questions. 
Sincerely, 
Georgia Department of Corrections 
You can monitor the progress of your request in " My Records Center"

The Georgia Department of Corrections (GDC) received your request for the policies related to transgender inmates. All of the GDC's publicly accessible standard operating procedures (SOPs) can be found on our website at https://gdc.georgia.gov/organization/about-gdc/policies-and-procedures.

title: Suicide in the Military (Department Of Defense, Office Of The Under Secretary For Personnel And Readiness)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Suicide in the Military (Department Of Defense, Office Of The Under Secretary For Personnel And Readiness)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am seeking additional information about suicide in the military beyond what is presented in the attached 2022 Annual Report on Suicide in the Military.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the years 2015-2023:
1) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state;
2) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means;
3) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc);
4) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility;
5) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means;
6) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Burd-Sharps
Kathryn Fingar
Mackey O'Keefe
Paige Tetens

communications.subject: RE: [Open Records Request] Form Submission Results
communications.communication:
Good morning.

Please be advised that we are in receipt of your request. Pursuant to Georgia’s Open Records Act, the College is permitted to assess a reasonable fee for the administrative costs and copying fees associated with your request. The administrative fee that can be charged must not exceed the salary of the lowest paid full time employee who has the necessary skill and training to perform the request. This administrative fee may be charged for all but the first quarter hour of time required to complete the request. We have contacted the appropriate office to assist in the retrieval of this information and have requested an approximate cost to do so, if any. In accordance with the applicable time line, we will provide requested documents, an estimate of cost, or an update regarding your request. If you desire to have copies of any of the documents, please let us know, but be advised that a copying fee of $0.10 per page will be charged.

Please feel free to contact our office with any questions or concerns.

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (Bucks County Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Yuma County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Yuma County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Arizona Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on April 3, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

1.Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS. This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen.  

•         NSC CPR/First Aid Training 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".) 

•         Per facility as per recommendations by Licensed Medical Director’s discretion and based on each situation circumstance. 

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis). 

•         No set protocol - Care provided is per Licensed Provider recommendation and is based on individual treatment plan

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

•         See attached.

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff-See 

*       Attached

I am also requesting the following data and forms:
1-      Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information. 

•         To date, we have had 33 inmates identified to be HIV positive that were booked in the last two years

·         To date, we have had 103 inmates identified to have Hep C (both cured/untreated) that were booked in the last two years

·         Month to month data is not available  at this time as the data is directly connected to identifying information 

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

 Attached.

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Idaho SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Idaho Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request a list of email addresses for all active Boston Police Department officers, including officer rank/title, Officer assignment or department if available.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Records Requester

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B001141-042325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST B001141-042325 created 4/23/2025 9:09:47 AM Dear Records Requester, The Boston Police Department (Department) has received your request for public records.  This response applies only to records that exist and are in the custody of the City.  See A Guide to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, p. 32, n.115.  It is expected that a custodian of records must use her superior knowledge of her records with respect to responses to public records requests.  950 CMR 32.04(5).  Specifically, you requested: I request a list of email addresses for all active Boston Police Department officers, including officer rank/title, Officer assignment or department if available. We have reviewed our files and have located records that correspond to your request. I am checking to see if we have a list of email addresses and will get back to you. But for the list of names and rank, please go to https://data.boston.gov/dataset/employee-earnings-report You may appeal this response to the Supervisor of Records in the Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth. G. L. c. 66, § 10A (c); G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(ix); 950 CMR 32.08; 950 CMR 32.08(1)(h) (in petitioning the Supervisor, the requester shall provide a copy of such petition to the records access officer associated with such petition).  You may also appeal to the Superior Court.  950 CMR 32.06(3)(c). Thank you. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXTIDeIcW7QPGcxbg2r6mBl4IQAtcuUR-2B6-2B48u6MWdi-2FuNfsoFtzUO-2FiE2Z5NHdOxR8S4-2BUBVhRBHHVYKZbupVJk7uRnLLIamhDhW2l1hygj394aE_SMDR7-2FuvTDRbNSt-2FdsqBsq6YyLd9KBUS2IXIbFuFxxxkzTAc3dfMKOZEwYQiA73Mb5TkdVTcMPetBdc9wfbt3J8j9Xq-2Bj0H07gULRejb055BFKgVSp00z5OUg4THdlcMhYl6Zf-2BnXCj6-2BODj7D-2FbL6VSP6KOK32yXlR-2FR-2FbJ4upi02BGBXB21GeYTfU-2F1MYK6-2BeM52cxHRce2agpKsTXgvIBuqzCzfCJmMyyY-2FDrRCc3TYfkq6bLBIw4L1vKQGldBGh0Br3nxHFaNKHKOVzn-2FjnL9SGCIRFlNC73SelMQ-2BhtIegfeC9Xkesp-2BjJmFg9z9N7-2FED6JiMPDxWOwayAMjtKyYAWvhb30-2FaECYCfYdhK1vgtMzPdn1IAPxO6stnxT)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://www.local10.com/news/local/2024/04/06/dental-assistant-accused-of-driving-drunk-in-florida-keys/

Date of Occurrence
9 a.m., on April 19., 2024

Location of Occurrence
area of Big Pine Key

Names of parties involved: 
Jessica Lynn Dowling

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: University of North Texas drag ban (University Of North Texas System)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: University of North Texas drag ban (University Of North Texas System)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications received, sent, or created by or for Chancellor Michael Williams, President Harrison Keller, Regent Laura Wright, Steve Moore, or any person employed by the University of North Texas System Office of Government Relations, on or after January 20, 2025, which either:

(a) concerns drag performances, including the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10 and the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11; or 

(b) contains any of the following terms: "Executive Order", "gender ideology", "Queer Empowerment", "drag show", "drag shows", "drag performance", "drag performances", "drag night", "queer alliance", "YDSA", or "Young Democrats"; 

2. Any Title IX (or similar) complaint or report referencing the word "in drag", "drag performance", "drag show", "drag shows", or "drag performances". This request is limited to complaints filed on or after January 1, 2020.

3. Any records held by administrators or staff of the University of North Texas concerning the planning, logistics, or approval of (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

4. If the University of North Texas maintains a reservation system or database for event reservations, all entries (and records contained in the system) concerning (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Your Recent Public Information Act Request (UNT 139)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Steinbaugh,

UNTS is in receipt of your public information request (copied below), received via email on Monday, March 24, 2025. The responsive information collected is voluminous, totaling more than 1500 pages. In the interest of expediting review and release of this information, would you consider narrowing your query by date/time frame, records custodian, and/or keyword(s)?

Please reply to this email. In accordance with Tex. Gov't Code Sec. 552.222, your request will be considered withdrawn if you do not respond in writing within 61 days.


Request for: Any communications received, sent, or created by or for Chancellor Michael Williams, President Harrison Keller, Regent Laura Wright, Steve Moore, or any person employed by the University of North Texas System Office of Government Relations since February 15, 2025, which either:
(a) concerns the "I Bear Witness" art exhibit in the Student Union (including opposition by lawmakers, the public, or others to the exhibit), as referenced at https://www.keranews.org/news/2025-03-05/lawmakers-demand-unt-remove-student-art-exhibit-on-palestinian-conflict-claiming-antisemitism; or
(b) contains any of the following terms: "Executive Order", GA-44, GA44, Israel, Palestine, Palestinian, Israeli, Gaza, anti-semitic, antisemitic, anti-Israel, Muslim, Title VI, IHRA, propaganda, genocide, exhibit, First Amendment, free speech, freedom of speech, freedom of expression, Mitch Little, Jared Patterson, Richard Hayes, Andy Hopper, or Ben Bumgarner; or
(c) was sent to or received from one or more of the following lawmakers, their offices, or their aides: Mitch Little, Jared Patterson, Richard Hayes, Andy Hopper, or Ben Bumgarner.
Best,

Colleen Gallagher

Assistant General Counsel and Public Information Officer

Office of General Counsel

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Missouri Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Louisiana Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

05/05/2025 
 
Rose Terse 
186100-78023881@requests.muckrock.com 
 
RE: Public Disclosure Request#: P224491-050425 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 

This communication is in response to your public disclosure request received on May 04, 2025. This request is asking for items that are publicly available online and can be located at the following addresses: For the ALPR program: https://www.seattle.gov/documents/Departments/Tech/FINAL_English_ALPR_Patrol.pdf https://www.seattle.gov/police/community-policing/community-programs/alpr For the CCTV/RTCC program and the location of the cameras: https://statics.teams.cdn.office.net/evergreen-assets/safelinks/1/atp-safelinks.html 
Be advised the ALPR devices are not stationary, they are attached to vehicles, therefore there isn't a specific 'location' for them. As for the CCTV program, the entire program goes live on May 20th, 2025 and as of now, the only cameras that are live are in the CID area. However, the map will show the location of the entire program. 
SPD will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so within 10 business days. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Please include your name, address, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. 
Please submit your appeal via GovQA, the mail, or deliver your appeal to: 
Seattle Police Department 
Attn: Legal Section 
610 Fifth Avenue 
P.O. Box 34986 
Seattle, WA 98124-4986 
 
If you have any questions, you may send a message using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481. 
 
Sincerely, 
Justin Jackson 
Seattle Police Department 
Legal Unit

patience.

title: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2014 Nov Midterm Elections
2. 2016 Nov General Election
3. 2018 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in Orange County in that year. Alameda County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: DHS UAP Reports (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS UAP Reports (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of each report of Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena (UAP), regardless of forum (air, water, space, transmedium) created by DHS personnel, systems or censors between November 18, 2024, and December 14, 2024. 

Please specifically task a search for Remote Video Surveillance Systems Upgrade (RVSS-U) camera systems, including Integrated Fixed Towers (see https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25246431-2024-10-16-green-higgins-bishop-to-mayorkas-dhs-re-usbp-camera-towers/), CBP Air and Marine Operations (including manned DHS craft, unmanned DHS craft, CBP’s TARS aerostat device, and other systems) https://www.cbp.gov/sites/default/files/assets/documents/2021-Aug/TARS_508%20compliant.pdf, and the CBP Commissioner’s Office. 

Descriptions of these phenomena have used “drones” and “UAP” interchangeably. Please task a search that would yield UAP drone reports where the operator and origin has not been identified.

Thank you in advance for your timely cooperation and response. 

Pursuant to 5 C.F.R 5.5(e), I respectfully request expedited processing. I provide the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746, declaring that they are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding: 

1. Recent reports of UAP have created a subject of exceptional and widespread media interest about which there exists questions regarding the government’s conduct..
See, e.g., and sources cited in paragraphs below.
 A. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/drone-sightings-spread-new-jersey-officials-express-outrage-federal-re-rcna184107 
 B. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/drones-new-jersey-what-we-know/
 C. https://www.cnn.com/2024/12/12/us/new-jersey-drone-sightings/index.html
 D. https://apnews.com/article/fbi-drones-new-jersey-0f4aba00748ac464d42270fbe7457733
 E.  https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/what-we-know-about-the-mysterious-drones-flying-over-new-jersey
 F. https://www.forbes.com/sites/stephenpastis/2024/12/11/unexplained-reports-of-drones-flying-over-new-york-new-jersey-and-pennsylvania-heres-what-we-know/

2. Beginning on or around November 18, 2024, multiple reports of UAP over the skies of New Jersey began to pour in. 

3. The UAP sightings occurred above one of the homes of the President-elect, and highly sensitive U.S. military installations, including the Picatinny Arsenal (see https://www.nrc.gov/info-finder/decommissioning/complex/picatinny-arsenal.html). 

4. DHS is reportedly assisting in the federal coordination of the government’s response to these UAP reports. https://defensescoop.com/2024/12/12/new-jersey-unidentified-drones-dod-poised-to-respond-if-threaten-military-assets/; https://apnews.com/article/fbi-drones-new-jersey-a978470fa3bb07ed3e98c5b7c18f0abb

5. On December 13, DHS and FBI released a joint statement regarding this response: https://www.dhs.gov/news/2024/12/12/joint-dhsfbi-statement-reports-drones-new-jersey. https://www.insidegovernmentcontracts.com/2024/01/implications-of-the-unidentified-anomalous-phenomena-uap-amendment-in-the-2024-national-defense-authorization-act-ndaa/ 

6. To date, despite abundant video evidence, official confirmation from law enforcement and state officials, and federal lawmakers’ questions, the government is unable to identify the origin, operator, or technological nature of the phenomena. https://www.npr.org/2024/12/11/nx-s1-5226000/new-jersey-drones.
 
7. Instead, senior White House officials appear to dispute what people, including law enforcement officers, are witnessing and recording. https://www.twz.com/air/white-house-says-none-of-the-new-jersey-visual-drone-sightings-have-been-corroborated. 

8. Congress has held briefings on these phenomena; they produced no definitive answers from the U.S. government. https://ktxs.com/news/nation-world/pentagon-officials-hold-classified-briefing-with-congressn-uaps-ufos-new-jersey-sightings-drones-police-fbi-faa-regulations-bedminster-donald-trump-military-sites; https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/pentagon-officials-hold-classified-briefing-with-congressn-uaps-ufos-new-jersey-sightings-drones-police-fbi-faa-regulations-bedminster-donald-trump-military-sites

9. In the absence of definitive, public assessments, elected officials are considering a limited declaration of emergency: https://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2024/12/10/New-Jersey-Jon-Bramnick-drones-UAP-UFO-limited-emergency/9881733858673/. 

10.  Congress previously required collection of UAP records by no later than February 2024 in sections 1841-43of the FY23 National Defense Authorization Act’s adaptation of the UAP Disclosure Act of 2023. https://www.insidegovernmentcontracts.com/2024/01/implications-of-the-unidentified-anomalous-phenomena-uap-amendment-in-the-2024-national-defense-authorization-act-ndaa/.  

11. The White House has declared the sightings are not attributable to a foreign nation. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/12/13/drones-over-new-jersey-white-house-lawmakers/76956011007/. 

12. Government officials, including DOD’s Susan Gough, have stated that the UAP activity is not attributable to a U.S. research program. 

13. At least one U.S. Senator has called for U.S. military assets to shoot down these UAP, notwithstanding the publicly stated position of federal and state officials that they are not hostile, not experimental, and not identified. https://abc7ny.com/post/new-jersey-drones-us-senator-says-mystery-devices-spotted-nj-should-shot-down-necessary/15647143/. 

14. True to form, New Jersey residents have also suggested taking matters into their own hands and shooting down the phenomena as well. https://www.foxnews.com/us/drones-mystery-new-jersey-homeowners-threaten-take-matters-own-hands-govt-doesnt-act.

15. In the absence of clear, consistent communications from U.S. officials, heightened tensions regarding the inability or unwillingness of the government to explain what is happening above the skies of New Jersey, there is an increasing risk to the health and safety of people who are making the reports and capturing the video images of whoever or whatever is visiting the Garden State.

16. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: New Message - 2025-HQFO-01520
communications.communication: "12/20/2024 SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: 177543-22022333@requests.muckrock.com Andrew Free n/a MuckRock News, DEPT MR177543 Boston, Massachusetts 02115 Re: 2025-HQFO-01520 Dear Requester: This letter acknowledges receipt of your 12/16/2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), for a copy of each report of Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena (UAP), regardless of forum (air, water, space, transmedium) created by DHS personnel, systems or censors between November 18, 2024, and December 14, 2024. This office received your request on 12/16/2024. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, the Department processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although DHS’ goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, DHS will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.﻿ Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters. As a non-commercial requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free, as are the first two hours of search time, after which you will pay the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher. We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. This office will contact you before accruing any further fees. Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-HQFO-01520. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or 202-343-1743."

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any slideshows, presenter notes, or handouts produced for speakers at the 11 December 2024 briefing on drone sightings at the New Jersey State Police Operations Center;
- Any written meeting minutes or audiovisual records of that meeting.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents. For example, if any of the slides in the slideshow contain law enforcement sensitive data, please black out that data and provide the rest of the slideshow.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Dear Requester:

This letter acknowledges receipt of your 12/13/2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), for - Any slideshows, presenter notes, or handouts produced for speakers at the 11 December 2024 briefing on drone sightings at the New Jersey State Police Operations Center;
- Any written meeting minutes or audiovisual records of that meeting. This office received your request on 12/13/2024.

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, the Department processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although DHS’ goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, DHS will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.

Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters. As a non-commercial requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free, as are the first two hours of search time, after which you will pay the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher. We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. This office will contact you before accruing any further fees.

We have queried the appropriate component(s) of DHS for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the analysts in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.

Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-HQFO-01509. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence.

If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or 202-343-1743."

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Wyoming Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

This email acknowledges receipt of your Right-to-Know request pursuant to NH RSA 91-A and constitutes the New Hampshire Department of Education's response pursuant to RSA 91-A:4, IV(b).

Please note that Right-to-Know requests are processed by the agency in the order that they are received.

We will begin the process of researching and compiling the requested information immediately and will reply to you as quickly as possible. communications.subject: Request# 2025-0114 : Request Submission Acceptance Confirmation
communications.communication:
Please DO NOT reply to this email !! Please use the email address of the sender at bottom of this email, in order to communicate with the request management team. 
Malden, MA 
Public Record Request Number:2025-0114 
Requester: JPat Brown 
Request Date: Tuesday, April 22, 2025 8:18:00 AM 
Response Due Date: Tuesday, May 6, 2025 

Dear  JPat Brown : 

We have received your public Records request for Malden. This record is being assigned to appropriate department. The department reviewer will review the request and create an effort estimate to create the response. Per state mandate, for Malden, if the effort estimate is more than 2 hours, we will create a proposed cost estimate and will email such estimate to your attention. Once you approve the amount and send the payment, we will start working on your request. 

In case the estimate is less than 2 hours, we will proceed to work on the response and will send you the response once the work is completed. Please also note that state mandate allows us to complete and send the response within 10 business days. We will do our due diligence towards this effort. However, the due date may be extended for any of the following reasons: 
1.   Any clarification that is required from you towards this request will stop the clock. The clock will be resumed once the proper clarification is received. 
2.   Payment of estimated effort – The time it takes to receive the due amount will be added to the original due date. 
3.    If in the opinion of the reviewer it is determined that original due date cannot be met despite reasonable effort, the due date shall be extended based on reviewer’s judgment. You will be promptly notified in such case with revised due date. 
Thank you. 
Public Records, RAOClerk Department 

Malden 
215 Pleasant St 
Malden, MA 02148 
Tel: (781)-397-7000 
Email: publicrecords@cityofmalden.org

Dear JPat Brown: 
We have completed the work in reference to your request as referenced above. The response is given below. Request Response Responsive documents previously provided in FD 2025-0049 can be viewed by using the link below: https://www.townforms.com/FOIADirect-MaldenMACitizens/Public/Request/PublicRequestDetails.aspx 
In addition, attached please find (11) emails where the word "homeless" appears in the senders signature line and (4) emails that the word homeless appears in the attachment(s).  Please note that cell phone numbers were redacted in accordance with Exemption (c). Attachments 
This response may or may not contain separate Response Documents to include specific response and data. In case such separate response documents exist, they are represented by attachments to this response email. Therefore, please look for any attachments if they exist. Between Request Response and attachments, we believe you are receiving a comprehensive response to your request. 
If you have any questions or comments, please do not hesitate to contact us at the following email address. 
Thank you. Anthony Rodrigues, Assigned Department Records AdministratorIT Department Department 
Malden 
215 Pleasant Street 
Malden, MA 02148 
Tel: (781)-397-7000 
Email: arodrigues@cityofmalden.org 
You are advised that if you object to this response to your request, you have the right to petition the Commonwealth of Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. Your petition for appeal of this response must be made within 90 calendar days of the date of this response, in writing, and must specify the nature of your objections to this response, and include a copy of your electronic request with all header information including the time, date, subject, sender and recipient email address, and a copy of the within written response, and the attachment(s) related hereto. 
Your petition should be sent to the Supervisor at the following address: Supervisor of Records Division of Public Records, Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth, One Ashburton Place, Room 1719, Boston, Massachusetts 02108 or: pre@sec.state.ma.us. Electronic communication is strongly encouraged and is the preferred method of correspondence.

title: Crisis Assistance Response and Engagement (CARE) Employee Roster

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Crisis Assistance Response and Engagement (CARE) Employee Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A complete and current roster of all former and current employees of the Crisis Assistance Response and Engagement (CARE), including for each employee:

Full name
Age
Gender
Race
Job title
Department or division
Work email address (if available)
Date of hire (if available and non-exempt)
Date of termination (if relevant)

If any of the above fields are exempt from disclosure, please redact only the exempt information and release the remainder of the records in accordance with the partial disclosure provisions of applicable public records law. I am not requesting any personally identifiable information that is protected by law, such as Social Security numbers or personal contact information.

I would prefer to receive this information in electronic format (e.g., CSV, Excel, or PDF) if available.

If there are any fees for searching or copying the records, please inform me before processing the request. I also request a waiver of fees as the information is being sought for research and public interest purposes, not for commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests

title: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act request made between 2010 and 2018 that includes the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to sexual misconduct policy. I ask that all fields — including the subject of the request, the nature and description of the request, the requester, the status of the request, the dates on which it was requested and the date of its most recent status, the tracking number assigned to the request, and the final disposition of the request — be included.

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: 2021 Shooting of Halyna Hutchins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for all records available in the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins on set of the film "Rust". Medical examiners report, autopsy, police reports - would be appreciated.

Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Gandhi

communications.subject: FW: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: 2021 Shooting of Halyna Hutchins
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

I will be completing your request for records regarding the case of Halayna Hutchins death investigation.

The Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office has created a Dropbox with all evidence related to case: SFSO 2021007949

Can you please provide me with an email address that you will use to access the files via Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office Dropbox? Once you have provided that information, I will add you to the list to gain access and send you the link you will need.

Thank you,

If you have any questions, please let me know.


Denise Womack Avila
Denise Womack Avila
SFSO PIO/ Media Coordinator
505-986-2434
